head.title: Home - Archer City ISD

input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; text-align: left;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Your school counselors care about you! Here are a variety of resources we have put together to help get you through this unusual time.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: If you need help or need to connect with one of us, please feel free to email us. Elementary students/parents should contact Vicky Lopez (

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);

background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: ). Junior high/high school students/parents should contact Leslie Graham (

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);

background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; text-align: left;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: It is ok to be experiencing a whirlwind of emotions right now. Some of you are homebodies or prefer online learning and love staying home. Others may even be experiencing various levels of anxiety or panic. Feeling some anxiety is perfectly normal right now. Often, fear and anxiety gets worse when you feel like you don’t have control--but you do have control over many things right now:

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Wash your hands and stop touching your face. Yes, it really is that simple. 1) Stay socially connected. Humans are social beings and thrive on connection with each other. Since we all need to be practicing social distancing, we need to connect in ways that are safe. FaceTime with a friend. Text someone you haven’t heard from in a while. Have a Netflix party. Be creative and use technology to connect. 2)Stay active. Fresh air is good for us. Go for a walk. Some fitness apps are currently free to help support people over the next month (check out Down Dog for yoga, HIIT, and a variety of other workouts). 3)Do things that relieve stress for you. Check out apps such as Headspace or Calm if that appeals to you. Or maybe pull out a board game or a deck of cards. Spend time with your family. Binge-watching your favorite shows is ok for a while, but don’t let it consume all your time. 4)Disconnect. After spending a lot of time on your computer or phone, walk away from technology for a bit. Your eyes and brain will need a rest!

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; text-align: left;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-size: 14.6667px; white-space: pre-wrap;
background-color: transparent; text-align: center;

strong.style: color: rgb(112, 111, 111); font-family: "Open Sans", sans-serif; font-size: large; white-space: pre; background-color: transparent;

div.strong: If you feel the need to find out more about COVID-19, use reputable resources:

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);

p.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; text-align: left;

a.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap; text-decoration-line: none;

p.style: text-align: left;
p.br: If you want an easy way to check in with one of us, you are welcome to fill out this form:

p.style: text-align: left;
text-align: left;
text-align: left;

div.p: If you have any problems please email support@archercityisd.net. It is important that students check their email daily and accept any class codes, etc. that may be sent by teachers, etc.

p.style: text-align: left;

div.p: If you do not have Internet access available, please call your campus office and let them know. Do not panic! Alternate instruction will be available.

p.style: text-align: left;

div.p: Campus offices will be open weekdays, 9AM-noon with a limited staff. Do not hesitate to call if you have questions:

p.style: text-align: center;

table.style: width: 574px; height: 722px; top: 60px; background-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); left: 264px;

td.style: background-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-align: center; vertical-align: top;

td.span:
Archer City Independent School District is proud to offer an environment for learning with an emphasis not only on academics but also on
character education, global citizenship, and community.
We are blessed with an administration that genuinely cares about each and every student.
The mission of Archer City ISD is to provide each
student a diverse education in a safe, supportive
an environment that promotes self-discipline,
motivation, and excellence in learning. The ACISD
team joins the parents and community to assist
students in developing skills to become independent
and self-sufficient adults who will succeed and
contribute responsibly in a global community.
ACISD has produced many successful graduates aspiring on to vocational careers and collegiate endeavors such as MIT, West Point, Notre Dame, and the Air Force Academy.
Our facilities provide a modern, technology-driven atmosphere that prepares students for the real world.
A student to teacher ratio of 10:1 provides a personal climate that nurtures the overall well-being of each individual student.

span.br:
Contact ACISD today for a tour and
a chance to meet our fine staff.
Come be a Wildcat!

div.style: border-width: 0px; position: absolute; overflow: hidden; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; left: 3px; top: 19px; width: 1px; height: 1px;

p.style: margin: 0px; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12.8px;

div.p:
Located in north central Texas, the rural community of Archer City serves as the county seat of Archer County. ACISD has produced many successful graduates aspiring on to vocational careers and collegiate endeavors such as MIT, West Point, Notre Dame, and the Air Force Academy.
Our facilities provide a modern, technology-driven atmosphere that prepares students for the real world. Students and teachers use a variety of technological resources on a daily basis.
A student to teacher ratio of 10:1 provides a personal climate that nurtures the overall well-being of each individual student. Contact ACISD today for a tour and a chance to meet our fine staff

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

span.style: text-decoration: underline;

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

div.p:
The health and safety of our students, staff, and community is a priority for Archer City ISD. In an
abundance of caution, Archer City ISD has developed a plan to help limit the spread of COVID-19 should
the spread of the disease continue and impact Archer City ISD or the surrounding area. There is certainly
no reason to panic, but here are some things that parents and students can do to reduce the risk of
contracting diseases like COVID-19.
1. Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
2. Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue
in the trash.
3. Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth.
4. Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.
5. Stay home when you are sick, except to get medical care.
6. Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. *
If there is a confirmed case of COVID-19 within 25 miles of Archer City ISD we will implement the
following Phase 1 procedures:
1. Recommend that medically fragile students and/or staff, particularly those with
compromised immune systems or respiratory problems stay home until the high threat of
infection has passed or subsided. Archer City ISD teachers and staff will work to ensure that
instruction for those students continues without interruption.
2. Students and staff will be closely monitored for signs of respiratory infection, and students
or staff with fever will be sent home. A doctor’s note will be required for admittance back to
school. (This would be a change from current policy where students can return to school if
they are fever-free for 24 hrs.)
3. ACISD will increase the use of aerial disinfectants during routine classroom cleaning after
hours. Disinfection of highly used surfaces (doorknobs, water fountains, and desks) will be
increased to multiple times during the day. Buses will undergo the same aerial disinfection
as classrooms.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

div.p:
If there is a confirmed case of COVID-19 in Archer City ISD we will implement the following Phase 2
procedures:
1. Continue all procedures implemented in Phase 1.
2. Home Quarantine all students and staff who had close contact with the person who had the
confirmed case of COVID-19 for a minimum of two weeks or until medically cleared by a
physician. (If practical to do so, otherwise move to Phase 3 immediately)

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

div.p:
If there are multiple confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Archer City ISD we will implement the following
Phase 3 procedures:
1. Archer City ISD would be closed for a minimum of 2 weeks or as recommended by local
health officials.
2. Thorough cleaning and disinfecting of all facilities would occur prior to a return to school.
3. Any state testing, extracurricular activities and days missed would have to be made up at a
later date.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

div.p:
4. Archer City ISD will arrange to continue to provide meals for students receiving free or
reduced meals.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

div.p:
This plan is subject to change based on changing information or as directed by State and/or Local
Authorities.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px 0px; display: inline; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

div.p:
Further info from the Texas Education Agency is found below:
TEA Info Regarding COVID-19
